skillTree.localised_description: This Lord of Undeath projects an aura of dominion that can wilt the most iron-willed mortals.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: A dark pact has been made with darker Gods to guarantee victory.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when attacking
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The summoner wrestles with the winds of magic, beckoning the long-dead people of an extinct civilization to awaken from their thousand year long slumber.

effects.description: Ability: "People of the Old dynasty"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Wild Heart"

skillTree.localised_description: As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Curse of Undeath"

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

skillTree.localised_description: Many early human kingdoms defied the might of the Celestial Dragon, and although many generations have now forgotten their names, the earth still remembers.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against Cathay
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Undead Infantry and Cavalry
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dabbling in the art of witchcraft placed an extreme risk upon the sorceror, for curses were a double-edged sword; any prudent sorceror would be wise to at least try to mitigate its damning effects.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 20%
Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: Mummified remains of their old followers rise from the shadowy underworld; ready to worship their leaders in faith many thousand years ago.

effects.description: Ability: "Cult of Forbidden Ancestors"

skillTree.localised_description: Ancestor Witches were the chief shamans and elders of many early Cathayan civilizations, most notably the ancient Dynasty of Xiang, which was known for its embrace of magecraft.

effects.description: Winds of magic cost: -25% to Lore of Primeval Witchcraft spells
Cooldown: -30% to Lore of Primeval Witchcraft spells

skillTree.localised_description: A shroud of grief blankets the subject of the curse; ill-begotten memories soon flood the mind and cripple one's desire to live.

effects.description: Winds of magic cost: -1 to "O, Sorrow; Be Consumed"
Cooldown: -30% to "O, Sorrow; Be Consumed"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a small amount of health

effects.description: Winds of magic cost: -2 to "O, Sorrow; Be Consumed"
Passive ability: "Life Leeching"

skillTree.localised_description: The witch angrily flails the effigy around, channeling pure anger into her her incantations.

effects.description: Ability: "O, Anger; Be Brandished"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a small amount of health

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "O, Anger; Be Brandished"

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Twisted desires of jealousy and envy are poured into the curse with the intent of stripping away the victim's fortunes so harbored by its caster.

effects.description: Ability: "O, Envy; Become Coveted"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a moderate amount of health

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "O, Envy; Become Coveted"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a moderate amount of health

effects.description: Winds of magic cost: -2 to "O, Envy; Become Coveted"
Ability: "O, Envy; Become Coveted"

skillTree.localised_description: Uttering a guttural chant, the witch grits her teeth and visualizes her sworn enemies; fervently praying for their doom even at the cost of mutual destruction.

effects.description: Ability: "O, Hatred; Become Ash"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a moderate amount of health

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "O, Hatred; Become Ash"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a moderate amount of health

Ability: "O, Hatred; Become Ash"
Passive ability: "Evasion"

skillTree.localised_description: Less of a hex and more of a brute-forced application of sorcery; the witch furiously stabs the effigy, seeking to destroy those who wronged her.

effects.description: Ability: "O, Revenge; Be Shattered"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a large amount of health

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "O, Revenge; Be Shattered"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a large amount of health

effects.description: Winds of magic cost: -2 to "O, Revenge; Be Shattered"
Ability: "O, Revenge; Be Shattered"

skillTree.localised_description: Reaching into the darkest and most sinister of curses, the witch recites a word of severance, thus cutting the thread of life from the victim.

effects.description: Ability: "O, Death; Be Severed"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a large amount of health

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "O, Death; Be Severed"

ui_effects.localised_text: Consumes a large amount of health

Ability: "O, Death; Be Severed"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: "Forces of Necromancy, hear the request of your most-studious adept: flow through me according to my will!"

effects.description: Passive ability: "Greater Arcane Conduit"

skillTree.localised_description: "I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description: Character's aura leadership effect: +5

Enemy leadership: -4

skillTree.localised_description: "A wall of decaying flesh and bone slowly advanced towards us, implacable and utterly remorseless."

skillTree.localised_description: All manners of bogeys and fiends that lurk in the dark wood, idling patiently as the sun sets into the horizon -- and the night begins.

skillTree.localised_description: In the East, tales of ghosts are often brought up to scare and discipline children or spread around as petty entertainment, but in crumbling abodes and forgotten clanhouses, lingering spirits exist, languishing in murderous rage.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Wild Ghosts, Starved Marquis, Accursed Diao Si Gui and Pale Lady units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Cathayan underworld is home to many immetarial creatures, and some of these aren't as benevolent as Cathay's venerated ancestors.

skillTree.localised_description: "Charge, brothers! We are sworn-comrades in life, and now, in DEATH! For Xen Yang! For the Dragon Emperor!"

skillTree.localised_description: Grandy Cathay is home to many supernatural abominations that stalk the night and maliciously feast upon the populace's nightmares.

skillTree.localised_description: The endurance of boogeymen and other nightly frights that haunt the Cathayan psyche is perhaps one of the more intriguing aspects of their culture.

skillTree.localised_description: Not only satisfied in enacting revenge, some spirits go as far as to inflict misery and torment upon the living out of misplaced wrath and perceived injustices.

skillTree.localised_description: At sunset, when all the windows are barred and the crows have cawwed, the dread denizens of the night encroach upon the world of mortals from the shadows.

Melee attack: +5 for Fell bats, Gore Hags, Mogwai, Devil of Dark Omen and Yaoguai (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Deathless horses with eyes that burn like brimstone and hooves that leave trails of ghostflame; the jade banner flashes its accursed colors.

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit counts as a Yin unit for the purpose of Battle Harmony proximity.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates when within 60 metres of a Yang unit.
Effect intensity increases by highest nearby Harmony multiplier on a unit.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
